author: wsjcom
title: Constitution Says Congress, Not Economists
text: Regarding Alan S. Blinder’s “Pols Use Economics the Way Drunks Use Lampposts” (op-ed, March 27): As Ludwig von Mises pointed out, “economics is a theoretical science and as such abstains from any judgment of value.” It may tell us that price controls are likely to lead to shortages but is silent on whether or not such a policy should be pursued. It lacks the defined scale of values necessary to normative judgments. In a representative democracy, such judgments are left to the voter and their chosen representatives.
